Definitions.Paraphrase:
[U]the sending and receiving of messages over distance, esp. by telephone, radio and television 
电信，远距离通信
a telecommunications satellite 
长途通信卫星
the telecommunications industry 
电信业
The company specializes in telecommunications. 
这家公司专门从事长途通信。

lacking the power of speaking; unable to speak 
哑的，不会说话的
He was struck dumb with fear. 
他吓得说不出话来。
The prisoner remained dumb throughout his trial. 
整个审判期间犯人一言不发。

1. [C] a service used by the public, such as an electricity or gas supply or a train service 
公用事业，公用事业设施
a public utility 
公用事业公司
high utility bill 
高额公用事业开支
2. [U] the usefulness of sth., esp. in a practical way 
功用，效用，利用
Some kitchen tools have very little utility. 
有些厨房用具几乎没有什么用处。
The utility of this rescue equipment has still to be assessed in a real emergency. 
这种救生设备的功用还有待在真正的紧急情况中评定。

1.of or using light, esp. for the purpose of recording and storing information for use in a computer system 
光学的，光的
an optical fiber
光学纤维
Telescopes and microscopes are optical instruments. 
望远镜和显微镜都是光学仪器。
2.of or about the sense of sight; visual 
视力的，视觉的，眼睛的
an optical effect 
视觉效果
He suffers from an optical defect. 
他有视觉障碍。

[C] the (length of a) straight line that goes from one side of a round object to another, through the center of the object 
直径
The diameter measures twice the radius. 
直径为半径的两倍。
The pond is six feet in diameter. 
该池塘直径为6英尺。

[C] a unit of length which is equal to 0.001 meter 
毫米
A millimeter is one-thousandth of a meter. 
一毫米是一米的千分之一。

[C] (a length of ) wire, esp. twisted into thick strong rope or used to carry electricity 
缆索，电缆
There were cables used for telephones, lights and computers all over the floor. 
地上满是电话、电灯、计算机的线缆。
The road has been dug up in order to lay cables. 
路被挖开以便铺设电缆。

[U] a soft reddish metal that is a simple substance that is easily shaped and allows heat and electricity to pass through it easily
紫铜，紫铜色
a bracelet made of copper 
铜制手镯

made of copper, reddish-brown color 
铜的，铜色的
copper wire / pipes 
铜线/铜管
Her hair shone copper in the sunlight. 
她的头发在阳光下闪着紫铜色。

1. [C] a series of people or things that seems never to end 
一连串，一批
an endless parade of advertisements 
一连串没完没了的广告
When I asked him about his childhood, he remembered a parade of baby-sitters. 
当我问起他的童年时，他记起了一大批保姆。
2. [C] a line of people, vehicles, etc. moving forward in order, often as a celebration of some event 
（庆祝）游行，检阅
The small boy loves watching the soldiers on parade. 
这个小男孩喜欢看士兵的检阅队伍。
The crowd marched through town in a victory parade. 
人群游行走过市中心，欢庆胜利。

[C]a small insect-like creature with eight thin legs 
蜘蛛
a spider's web 
蜘蛛网
Spiders produce fine threads which they make into webs in order to trap insects for food. 
蜘蛛用细丝做网来捕捉昆虫吃。

[C] a fine net made by a spider from a sticky substance which it produces from its body; sth. as complicated as a net 
(蜘蛛等的)网
The corners of the room were covered with spider's webs. 
房间的角落里结满了蜘蛛网。

1. reduce (esp. sth. written) to a smaller or shortened form 
缩短，压缩
The editor condensed the manuscript to half of its original length. 
编辑把稿子压缩成原稿的一半。
I've tried to condense ten pages of comments into two. 
我试图把十页长的评论文章缩短成两页。
2. (of a gas) become liquid or sometimes solid, esp. by becoming cooler 
（使）冷凝
Steam condenses into water when it touches a cold surface. 
蒸气接触冷的表面就凝成水珠。

involving a lot of activity, effort, or careful attention in a short period of time 
密集的，集中的，加强的
a one-week intensive course in English 
为期一周的英语强化课程
A lot of farming techniques have been abandoned because they were too labour-intensive. 
许多农业技术因过于劳动密集而被放弃了。

1. expecting great need; wanting very much 
极度需要的，非常想要的
They are desperate for help. 
他们极需要帮助。
She was desperate to get into university. 
她非常想上大学。
2. showing a willingness to take risks, esp. because one is in a bad situation that one wants to change 
拼死的，铤而走险的，绝望的
The doctors made one last desperate attempt / effort to save the boy's life. 
为挽救男孩的生命，大夫们作了最后一次拼搏。
They made a desperate plea for help. 
他们不顾一切地恳求帮助。

become covered with a kind of reddish-brown substance that is formed on iron and steel 
生锈
It'll rust if you leave it out in the rain. 
如果你让它淋雨，它会生锈的。
Years of being left out in the rain had rusted the metal chairs. 
由于常年淋雨，这些金属椅子生锈了。

[U]the reddish-brown substance that is formed on iron and steel 
铁锈
The car was covered with rust. 
车子满身是锈。

[C] sth. made long ago that is valuable or interesting 
古董
The palace is full of priceless antiques. 
王宫里全是价值连城的古董。
You can't give away Granny's old bookcase — it's a valuable antique. 
你不能把奶奶的旧书架送人，那是一件很有价值的古董。

1. defeat, overcome 
击败，克服
The computer people seem to have licked the problem. 
电脑人员看起来已经克服了这个问题。
2. pass one's tongue over sth. 
舔
The dog licked her hand. 
那条狗舔了舔她的手。
The child finished the dessert and then licked the plate. 
孩子吃完了甜点后把盘子舔得干干净净。

forming part of a plan or an aim to achieve a specific purpose or to gain an advantage 
战略的
strategic planning 
战略部署
The company has appointed a new marketing director to broaden its strategic expertise. 
这家公司任命了一位新的营销主管来增加战略规划方面的人手。

[C] a period when the economy of a country is not successful, business conditions are bad, industrial production and trade are at a low level and there is a lot of unemployment 
经济衰退
Many businesses are failing because of the continuing recession. 
由于经济持续衰退，许多公司都倒闭了。
The latest report confirms that the economy is in recession. 
最新报告证实经济在衰退。

cut or damage (a surface) slightly with sth. sharp or rough 
抓，搔，划
The cat scratched my hand. 
猫抓破了我的手。
Be careful not to scratch yourself on the roses. 
当心不要被玫瑰刺扎伤。

1. [C] an area which is governed as part of a country or an empire 
省
an inland province 
内陆省
2. (sing.) a subject or activity of special interest, knowledge or responsibility 
(学术)领域，活动范围
Theatre criticism is outside my province. 
戏剧评论不属于我的专业范畴。
Marketing is within the province of the sales department. 
市场销售属于销售部的职权范围。

1. of a province or of the provinces 
省的，地方的
provincial governments 
省政府
2. having or showing a narrow or limited view of life and current affairs 
眼界狭窄的
provincial attitudes 
眼界狭窄的看法

[C] the basic structure on which an organization or system is built and which makes it able to work 
基础设施
The war has badly damaged the country's infrastructure from electricity plants and generators to roads and bridges. 
战争严重破坏了该国从电厂、发电机到道路、桥梁等的基础设施。

1. make an official record of events, facts, etc. 
记载
They have logged more than 90 complaints. 
他们已经记录了90余例投诉。
The old plane had logged hundreds of hours of flying time. 
那架老飞机已经积累了数百小时的飞行记录。
2. cut down trees 
砍伐
The forest has been so heavily logged that it is in danger of disappearing. 
森林被严重砍伐，面临毁灭的危险。

1. [C] a thick unshaped piece of wood from a tree either the whole trunk that has been cut down or smaller pieces cut off
原木，木料
The cabin was built of logs. 
这个小屋是用原木造的。
2.  [C] an official written record of a journey, esp. in a ship or plane
航海（或飞行）日志
The captain described the accident in the ship's log. 
船长在航海日志中描述了这次事故。

1. [C] the point of highest intensity, value or achievement 
高峰，最高点
Traffic reached a peak between 8 and 9 in the morning. 
早晨8点与9点之间交通达到高峰。
She's at the peak of her career. 
她处于事业的鼎盛时期。
Traffic congestion is really bad at peak periods. 
高峰时段的交通拥挤非常严重。
2. [C] a pointed top, esp. of a mountain 
山顶，山峰
It is one of the most difficult peaks to climb in the whole range. 
在整个山脉中，这是最难爬的山峰之一。

put (money, effort, time, etc.) into sth. to make a profit or get an advantage 
投（资），投入
They will invest 5 million in the project. 
他们将为这个项目投资500万。
He refuses to invest in companies without a good social record. 
他拒绝向那些社会记录不佳的公司投资。
They have all invested significant amounts of time and energy in making this project the success that it is. 
他们都为这个项目达到现在的成功水平耗费了大量的时间和精力。

[C] a person who invests sth. 
投资者
A New York investor offered to acquire the company's shares for $13 each. 
一名纽约商人愿以每股13美元的价格收购这家公司的股票。

1.(sing.) an investment in business, with the hope of financial gain 
股份，利益关系
He holds a 40% stake in the company. 
他在这家公司拥有40%的股本。
The company is selling off its 15% stake in the Commercial Bank. 
这家公司正在出售15%的商业银行的股份。
I just don't feel I have a stake in how the trial comes out. 
审判结果如何，我觉得跟我一点关系也没有。
2. [C]a pointed piece of wood, metal, etc. for driving into the ground as a mark, for holding a rope, etc. 
桩，标桩
One of the stakes in the fence is broken. 
篱笆上的一根桩折断了。

make a legal agreement by which money is paid in order to use (land, a building, a vehicle or a piece of equipment) for an agreed period of time 
租借，出租
We have leased an apartment for one year. 
我们已租到一套公寓，租期为一年。
He had persuaded them to lease him a house. 
他已说服他们租给他一座房子。

[C]an agreement giving the use of a house, etc. on payment of rent 
租约
The lease runs out in two years' time. 
该租约两年后到期。
He has the flat on a long lease. 
他长期租用该公寓。
We signed the lease yesterday. 
我们昨天签了租约。

[C]a long narrow raised part of a surface, esp. a high edge along a mountain 
脊状突起部分，（尤指）山脊
the ridge of a wave
浪峰
We walked along the narrow mountain ridge to reach the summit. 
我们沿着狭窄的山脊爬向顶峰。

able to be depended on or trusted 
可靠的，可依赖的，值得信赖的
Is your watch reliable? 
你的表准吗？
My car is seven years old but it's still fairly reliable. 
我的汽车已开了7年了，仍然非常可靠。
John is very reliable — if he says he'll do something he'll do it. 
约翰很可靠——要是他说要做什么他就会做的。

[C]a small piece of paper, cloth or metal, on which there is information, fixed onto sth. larger 
标签，标牌
The house has a price tag of half a million pounds. 
这幢房子标价50万英镑。
Whose coat is this? Look at the name tag. 
这件外衣是谁的？看看姓氏标签。

1. [U] the way sth. is treated or used 
使用，对待方式
a radio designed for rough usage
为耐用而设计的收音机
With normal usage, the equipment should last for many years. 
正常使用的话，这些设备应该可以用很多年。
2. [U] the generally accepted way of using a language 
用法
a guide to common English usage 
常用英语用法指南
The earliest recorded usage of the word is in the twelfth century. 
最早有关该词用法的记录见于12世纪。

[U]the distance across sth. from one side to the other 
宽度，阔度，广度
It is 5 meters in width. 
它宽5米。

in, at or to no place; not anywhere 
任何地方都不
His room had a smell that could be found nowhere else in the house. 
他房间里有股味道，在房子里的其他地方都没有。
These young people have nowhere (else) to go. 
这些年轻人没有地方可去。

1. [U]the power or authority to use freely 
支配权，处置权
During your visit, I will put my room at your disposal. 
在你来访期间我会把我的房间给你用。
The young lady has entire disposal of the house. 
这位年轻的小姐对这座房子有完全的处置权。
2. [U] the act of getting rid of sth. 
处理，消除
His business is waste disposal. 
他的业务是处理垃圾。
Please see to the disposal of that rubbish. 
请负责处理掉那堆废物。

[U] the income that a government or company receives regularly 
（政府的）岁入，税收，（公司的）收入
The government was short of money because of falling oil revenues. 
由于石油收入减少，政府感到财政拮据。
The government got much revenue from taxes last year. 
政府去年从税收中获得大量收入。

(send) a copy of a document that travels in electronic form along a telephone line and is then printed on paper, and which arrives in a few seconds 
传真；发传真
I'll fax it to you. 
我会把它用传真发给你。
Fax me your reply. 
请用传真回复我。
I'll send you a fax with the details of the proposal. 
我会把建议的细节用传真发给你。

[C] a very small piece of matter that moves round the nucleus of an atom and that by its movement causes an electric current in metal 
电子

keep on doing sth. in spite of opposition or difficulty 
坚持不懈，执意
If he refuses to answer your phone calls, just persist until he does answer. 
如果他不接你的电话，一直坚持下去直到他接为止。
She persisted in reading the newspaper at the dinner table. 
她非要边吃晚餐边看报不可。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
have no choice about dealing with (sb., sth.) or doing (sth. unwanted or unpleasant) 
无法摆脱，解脱不了
We were stuck with unexpected visitors.
我们被迫接待不速之客。
I'm stuck with this job for the moment. 
我眼下被工作困住了。

Vocabularies.Word: a matter of sth. / doing sth.

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
sth. that needs or requires sth. else
需要……的问题，需要……的事情
It's simply a matter of letting people know in time. 
这只是个让人们及时知道的问题。
Some people prefer the old version to the new one. It's a matter of taste. 
有些人喜欢旧版本胜于新版本。这只是品味问题。

make a choice between （usu. two things or people）
在两者中作出选择
She had to choose between giving up her job or hiring a nanny. 
她必须在辞职和雇用保姆之间作出选择。
He had to choose between death and dishonor. 
他必须在死亡和屈辱之间作出选择。

have existed since (the date of building or origin) 
始于
This law dates from the 17th century. 
这条法律起源于17世纪。
Our friendship dates from college days. 
我们的友谊始于大学时代。

be in an unpleasant or boring situation and unable to change it or get away from it 
陷入
We were stuck in traffic for over an hour. 
我们被交通堵塞困了一个多小时。
He said his car had got stuck in the snow. 
他说他的车当时陷在雪里了。

deal with a subject, problem, etc. in a manner that is not thorough or complete 
触及表面 
The lecturer merely scratched the surface of the subject. 
演讲人仅仅谈了谈该题目的一点皮毛。
We left feeling that we had just scratched the surface of this fascinating country. 
我们离开这个神奇的国家时，觉得只了解了她表面的一些东西。

put one's name into a computer so that one can start using it 
进入（计算机）系统，登录 
You need a password to log on to the system. 
你要有密码才能登录该系统。
Customers pay to log on and chat with other users. 
顾客要付费才能登录系统与其他用户聊天。

available for one to use as one wishes 
供某人使用，由某人支配
Well, I'm at your disposal. 
好吧，我随时听你差遣。
He will have a car at his disposal for the whole month. 
这一整个月都会有一部车供他使用。

use (sth.) 
使用，利用
We could make better use of our resources. 
我们可以更好地利用我们的资源。
You should make full use of your contacts. 
你应该充分利用你的联络网。

remain level with (sb. or sth. that is changing or developing quickly) 
与……齐步前进
Are wages keeping pace with inflation? 
工资的提高能否与通货膨胀同步？
The company is struggling to keep pace with changes in the market place. 
这个公司正努力保持与市场变化同步。

fail to achieve as much as sb. or sth. else; fail to remain level 
落后，落在……后面
The little boy lagged behind his parents. 
那小男孩落在他父母的后面了。
We still lag far behind many of our competitors in using modern technology. 
在应用先进技术方面，我们仍落后于我们的许多竞争者。
曼哈顿区（美国纽约市政区名）
荷兰的，荷兰人的，（the ~） 荷兰人
